DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Radiology Disease Evaluation Present FDG-Positron Emission Tomography Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as magnetic resonance imaging) and a disease present (being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time)._Deauville score grades - from 1 to 5 with the score of 1 meaning no uptake consistent with lymphoma, up to 5 which means a dramatic increase in uptake and/or new sites of involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Radiology Disease Evaluation Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as magnetic resonance imaging) and a disease present (being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Radiology Disease or Disorder Evaluation Present
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Deauville score grades - from 1 to 5 with the score of 1 meaning no uptake consistent with lymphoma, up to 5 which means a dramatic increase in uptake and/or new sites of involvement.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Score 5: Markedly increased uptake > normal liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Score 5: Markedly increased uptake > normal liver.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Score 5: Markedly increased uptake > normal liver.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Score 3: Uptake > mediastinal blood pool and <= normal liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Score 3: Uptake > mediastinal blood pool and <= normal liver.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Score 3: Uptake > mediastinal blood pool and <= normal liver.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Score 4: Moderately increased uptake > normal liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Score 4: Moderately increased uptake > normal liver.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Score 4: Moderately increased uptake > normal liver.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Score X: New areas of uptake unlikely to be related to lymphoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Score X: New areas of uptake unlikely to be related to lymphoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Score X: New areas of uptake unlikely to be related to lymphoma
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography to produce a three-dimensional image of functional processes in the body. The system detects pairs of gamma rays emitted indirectly by a positron-emitting radionuclide (tracer), which is introduced into the body on the biologically active molecule (fludeoxyglucose) FDG. FDG is an analogue of glucose which when imaged will give tissue metabolic activity, in terms of regional glucose uptake.:an ordered reference standard.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography to produce a three-dimensional image of functional processes in the body. The system detects pairs of gamma rays emitted indirectly by a positron-emitting radionuclide (tracer), which is introduced into the body on the biologically active molecule (fludeoxyglucose) FDG. FDG is an analogue of glucose which when imaged will give tissue metabolic activity, in terms of regional glucose uptake.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
